comments:
I get an error when I try to compile my project with an aspect jar .I put an 
jar file in aspect path on project properties page.I use eclipse 3.1 and AJDT 
1.3.0 

org.aspectj.weaver.BCException
at org.aspectj.weaver.patterns.Pointcut.read(Pointcut.java:303)
at org.aspectj.weaver.patterns.AndPointcut.read(AndPointcut.java:90)
at org.aspectj.weaver.patterns.Pointcut.read(Pointcut.java:286)
at org.aspectj.weaver.ResolvedPointcutDefinition.read
(ResolvedPointcutDefinition.java:76)
at org.aspectj.weaver.AjAttribute.read(AjAttribute.java:103)
at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelAttributes.readAjAttributes
(BcelAttributes.java:59)
at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelObjectType.unpackAspectAttributes
(BcelObjectType.java:266)
at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelObjectType.<init>(BcelObjectType.java:127)
at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelWorld.makeBcelObjectType(BcelWorld.java:253)
at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelWorld.addSourceObjectType(BcelWorld.java:310)
at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelWeaver.addAspectsFromJarFile(BcelWeaver.java:213)
at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelWeaver.addLibraryJarFile(BcelWeaver.java:188)
at org.aspectj.ajdt.internal.core.builder.AjBuildManager.initBcelWorld
(AjBuildManager.java:571)
at org.aspectj.ajdt.internal.core.builder.AjBuildManager.doBuild
(AjBuildManager.java:204)
at org.aspectj.ajdt.internal.core.builder.AjBuildManager.batchBuild
(AjBuildManager.java:151)
at org.aspectj.ajde.internal.CompilerAdapter.compile(CompilerAdapter.java:122)
at org.aspectj.ajde.internal.AspectJBuildManager$CompilerThread.run
(AspectJBuildManager.java:191)

BCException thrown: unknown kind: 0
when batch building BuildConfig[C:\Documents and Settings\onurg\My 
Documents\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.ajdt.core\TestASP.generated.l
st] #Files=1

This might be due to a mismatch between the version of AspectJ used to compile
the classes in the jar file and the one used to compile the project. If they are
development builds, you should use exactly the same build for both.

matt is correct.  That error occurs if two different compiler versions are used.
 The version that built the jar will have created attributes in a particular
form but the version later opening the jar is different and is expecting a
different format.  We guarantee compatibility between AspectJ1.2.1 and
AspectJ1.5.0 - we don't guarantee compatibility between different dev builds of
AspectJ.  Can you recompile the aspect jar with the same compiler you are using
for your subsequent compile?

I recompiled my aspect  and project codes with same java compiler and it 
fixed my problem.Thank you very much.
